Abraham Lincoln to James K. Polk, 17 September 18471 MrE. B. Zabriskie, a nephew of theCaptainof that name who fell atBuena Vista, and who has himself served a year as a volunteer in theWar with Mexico, is an applicant for an appointment in thearmy– He is of good family and character; and should the appointment be conferred upon

him, many persons, including myself, would be much gratified–2

citations: Abraham Lincoln to William L. Marcy.

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed the letter.
2Elias B. Zabriskie did not receive the appointment.Abraham Lincoln to William L. Marcy.
